quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I had no idea when I got in that car and headed to New York I was going to quit.  I got on that ramp and I thought two hours, two hours to go.  Feeling good.  Listen to some tunes.  Should've peed before I left.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: Michael get to the good part.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Okay, so.  I get up to the building, I get to the revolving door... broken!  So I have to take the normal door.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: At least he is in the building.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No, No! I was so nervous it was the wrong building! I walked into the wrong building!

quotes.speaker: Everyone
quotes.line: [groans]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: He finally has a story everyone wants to hear... and he knows it.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Okay focus. Focus.  You're in the right building, you're with the right people; what happened?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I looked at Wallace and I said "I quit!" and as I turned to leave I looked back and I said "You have no idea how high I can fly."

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: Did you tell him how sick of him you were?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Why would I do that?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Well, wouldn't it feel good to tell him that he was incompetent?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: That he's wasted 15 years of your life?

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: Did you spit in his face?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: You guys have thought about this a lot more than I have. I just winged it.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: I love a good quitting story. It makes me feel like I have control over my own life.  Gives me hope.  Maybe I will have one of own someday.  [laughs] But I dream... so...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: [Michael has a 'sticky-hand' toy and snags a paper off Jim's desk and then laughs] About a week ago, Michael gave his 2-week notice. And, surprisingly there is a very big difference between Michael trying and Michael not trying.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Michael is that scotch?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Scotch with Splenda. Tastes like Splenda, gets you drunk like scotch. [in Oscar's ear] Clinky, clinky-clink.  Come-on... come on, come on.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [slightly drunk] What am I gonna do? I'll tell ya what I'm gonna do. I gonna do a little bit of this, a little bit of that.  I gonna stay up all day.  Gonna sleep it up all night. I'm gonna give it a OHH! HEY! HO!  And I'm going to stop worrying about calories.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: Maybe you should go into your office, close the door, and make some calls about jobs?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I have a job.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: For four more days.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Do you have any leads on a job?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Pam, what you don't understand is that at my level you just don't look in the want-ads for a job.  You are head-hunted.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: You called any headhunters?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Any good headhunter knows I am available.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Any really good headhunter would storm your village at sunset with overwhelming force and cut off your head with a ceremonial knife,

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Right, cause that's what we are talking about.

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.line: Uh, I need you to go over this client list and indicate any wrong or false data.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: You're 'I need you to' is my command.

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.line: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Hey Michael...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Can I talk to you a minute?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: You can talk to me for as long as you want. I have all the time in the world. [eats some spaghetti] Oh God! Blech! Phyllis!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: I just wanted to tell you that... Oh What?  [takes a present out from behind his back]  What's that?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Oh! Hey. What is this about?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Um, you know, cause your leaving and so, it's a farewell...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Oh.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: I hope I get to work with you someday again.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Me too, me too. Is this wine?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Ah... busted. Yes

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I already have wine.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Oh.

quotes.speaker: Isaac
quotes.line: [interviewee enters office] Hello.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Hi.

quotes.speaker: Isaac
quotes.line: Isaac Silby  here for the interview

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Uh, yes.  Please have a seat. It'll be a few minutes.

quotes.speaker: Isaac
quotes.line: Thank you. [to Michael] You interviewing too?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Hmm?

quotes.speaker: Isaac
quotes.line: Interviewing?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: For?

quotes.speaker: Isaac
quotes.line: Regional manager.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Yes I am.

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.line: For regional manager I've decided to go with an outside hire.  For obvious reasons.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Where you from?

quotes.speaker: Isaac
quotes.line: Philly.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: That's a drive!

quotes.speaker: Isaac
quotes.line: Yeah, well this is one of the few places that's hiring.  It's uh, its brutal out there.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [sighs]

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Pam?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Hmm?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: When will the new copier be ready?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: I'm working on it Kev.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: You said it would be ready by today.  And it is today.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: It'll be ready soon.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Soon could mean anything. Soon could be 3 weeks.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Is that what 'soon' means to you?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Sometimes.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Then come back soon.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: During the course of business, a copier goes though something called 'Normal wear and tear.'

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.line: [feeding coins into a vent] I think it's 75 cents.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: That's a lot.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: [Bandit is chewing on wires] Bandit, No! No no no!

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: [dumps coffee all over the copier glass] Oh!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Yesterday, they delivered the new one. But they didn't set it up. So my day just got a little more interesting. [holds up a huge manual]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: [overhears loud monster noises] Its Monster dot com.  Singular.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Thank you. [groaning ceases]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: You work in paper long enough, you get to know the players. [dials phone]

quotes.speaker: Phone
quotes.line: Hi, you've reached Prince Paper.  We are sad to inform you that after 40 years of serving the community we are no longer in business.  Thank you for your support. May God bless you. [girl's voice] Bye!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [sighs] What am I gong to do?  Uh... [chuckles].

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: PSST! PSST!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Yeah... .you want me to come in your office?  Oh.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Okay, oh okay, okay.  Close your eyes.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: I would prefer not to.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Just close your eyes. I'm going to start my own paper company.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: You're starting your own paper company?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: yeah!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Why?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Can you believe... cause I know paper.  I know everything there is to know about paper.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Do you know the industry is in decline?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Yeah! Oh God. I practically invented decline.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Right.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Right, I know paper, I know how to manage. I have a name, close your eyes.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: No, I did that before, it added nothing.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Close them.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Okay. [keeps eyes open]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Alright, Michael Scott Paper Company. You want in? Do you want to be a part of this?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: I am not gonna do this.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Obviously.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: And you are not going to, either.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Oh, agreed, mmm, except...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Here's the thing.  What I wish for you is that you land a job at a company that A, exists, and B, has a salary.  Because they're set up to do that kind of thing.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Hey hey... what's up Chuck?

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.line: Jim.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.line: what are you doing?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Nothing, just talking.

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.line: Okay, Michael handed in his 2-week notice, did you also hand in your 2-week?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: I didn't... no.

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.line: Okay.  After you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No I'm staying.

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.line: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [examining the copier manual] Do you want me to translate the German instructions for you?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: No, I'm sure they're pretty much the same as the English instructions.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Typical American ignorance that got us involved in a war we never should have been in.  World War II.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: That's a really... well fine,  Do the German instructions say what this is supposed to do?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Deutsch... let me see here.  That is either an incense dispenser, or a ceremonial sarcophagus.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Hmm...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: My German is pre-industrial and mostly religious.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Pam, listen.  This order form.  Instead of saying "Dunder Mifflin" at the top is there any way I could get it to say something else?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Like Michael Scott Paper Company?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: You... oh.  Somebody has been talking in bed.  Pillow talk.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Hmm... yeah.  Listen Michael.  Have you really thought this through?  'Cause it's a pretty big risk.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: This is a dream that I have had since lunch, and I am not giving up on it now.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Yeah... you could give it up though right? And almost nobody would know.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Before you got here, I'm the one who landed all these clients.  Half of them, at least. I can do it again.  I know the market, I know the price points.  I'm on it, don't worry.  So, how do I do that?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Well, um, you can scan it, and then you can upload the image, and then you can copy the new image.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Can't I take some paper and just tape over it with transparent tape?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Yeah. Good.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Thank you very much.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Mmm-hmm

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: So that is why I have to leave at 5: 00 on Tuesday, it's to pick up my little sisters from school.  We're really tight. We're like the Kardashians..

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.line: You know, you can run this stuff by Toby.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: Yeah I don't like talking... [knock on door]

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.line: Come in...

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: I'm sorry, I didn't realize you were with anyone.  I just wanted to bring you the brochure on that accounting seminar that I was telling you about.  Earlier.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: Yep, we were in the middle of something so why don't you just...

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Okay, um, actually you know it was so much fun last year. There was a Sunday-bar.  I mean I didn't have any, you know, to stay trim.

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.line: Did Michael just let anybody in his office?

quotes.speaker: Angela and Kelly
quotes.line: Yep! Yeah. He just loved having people, communicating all the time. He was like 'Come on in!"

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.line: I am aware of the effect I have on woman.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: So you should be heading back to your desk.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Okay.  Bye Charles.  Well you'll let me know.  Good bye.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: She's such a special person.  And she's turning 50 this year.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I'm starting my own paper company.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: No way!?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: In this climate?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Yeah.  In all climates.  It's going to be worldwide.  And I'm looking for some talented salesmen to join me.  That's where you come in.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Ehh... [in accent] well it's a very intriguing concept, isn't it?  Um... hmmm..[makes weird noises to stall, Dwight enters] Michael is starting his own paper company. What do you think about that?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Your own paper company.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Can you believe it? Well, we'll see, we'll see. It's just a, just a nugget of an idea right now so

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Right...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Potential, lots of potential. yes.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: What a courageous venture.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: It's... it's very courageous, very exciting. Um...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Location is hard for me, with the farm and the responsibilities...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: That's what I was thinking, with the farm, so... You getting to wherever I'm gonna put my thing.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Okay. So yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: So think about it.  Lets put a pin in it for now.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: You know, I would love to put a pin in that.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Everyone, can I have your attention.  This is the moment you've all been waiting for. Right? [drum roll on copier]

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: Little Ms. Thing wants attention.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Meredith...  [copier has an error] Oh... so uh... G-44.  It's not ready Kevin!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: I'm at a crucial point where I have sunk 4 hours into that copier, and I am not going to let it beat me like that wireless router did.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: [bites his sandwich and notices there is a note in it]

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: You put a note in my food?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I made it sterile.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: Just to say "sterile" doesn't make it so.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I am offering you the opportunity of a lifetime, Oscar. To come work for me.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: Do you have a business plan?  A funding request? Market research, financials?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No, no no.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: You need those things.  Most new businesses, they don't make a profit till at least two years.  And then your margins will be razor thin. Best case scenario, you don't cut yourself a salary for at least 5 years.  Can you go 5 years without a salary, Michael?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: Five years?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Okay, hey, you already have the job.  You don't have to convince me.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: It's just not prudent Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [from inside the restroom] Stanley?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: Can't you see I'm urinating?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Listen, Listen, Stanley. You don't have to answer me now.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: No.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Just... I want you to think about it, I'm starting my own company.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: No.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Oh-okay, you're not letting me finish, and you just lost out on a million dollars.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: No I didn't.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: You know what.  I had a great time at prom.  And no one said 'Yes' to that either.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: How's it working?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Um, let's see... it's fine.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Good.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: I did it. I learned everything about this machine.  I know all the buttons, even the inside ones.   I know all the error messages.  I could do a bound book, in plastic with offset colors.  Which feels...

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.line: Hey Hank, You ready?

quotes.speaker: Hank
quotes.line: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.line: Okay, Michael?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Hmm?

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.line: I can't pretend I haven't seen that.  So I am going e to ask you to stand up, walk  out. And you can't take anything.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Okay, I have immunity. It's my two-weeks...

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.line: not if you're starting your own paper company, Michael. Hank...

quotes.speaker: Hank
quotes.line: Okay Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Hank?  You really think Hank is going to be loyal to you?  Hank, please escort Charles from the building.

quotes.speaker: Hank
quotes.line: Come on man, let's, let's go.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: I always thought Michael got a bad rap. He's a good guy.  And he's super funny.  Yeah, maybe I should tell him before he goes.  He's all the way over there.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [to everyone] Well here we are... I would just like to...

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.line: No, no no no.  You're done, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [yelling from Parking lot] Alright then everybody, I'm outta here!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: [from behind the upstairs window] What is he doing? It looks like he's saying something.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: I think he's singing.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: I can't believe this is really happening.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: ... and I feel free!

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: And just like that.  As mysteriously as he arrived, he was gone. [Michael sneaks back in the parking lot, and into a back door of the building]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: The whole office feels darker, you know?  It's just a sad dark day.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Andy He's gone.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: I know.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: You don't have to kiss his ass anymore.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Michael is like a movie on a plane.  You know, it's not great, but it's something to watch.  And when it's over you're like... how much time is left on this flight? Now what?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: [Michael is Army crawling around the office] Michael?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Shh shh shh... don't look down, look straight up. Come on please!

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: These are for employees only.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Angela Kevin, you have to help me out I just need a few things then I will be gone.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Michael, why is it that you asked everyone except me, Angela, Creed, and Meredith?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I was going to, I wanted to.  But I had to start somewhere.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: But you didn't want to start with us?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No, of course not.  But now I want everybody. Jim!  Jim?  Buddy, Hey!  Buddy, Jimbo?  Did you have time to think about my offer?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: I did have a chance to think about it, but then I thought about something else.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: So which way are you leaning?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Well it is tempting but I am 100% leaning towards something else.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Thanks Jim.

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.line: Hey, did anyone see the client list that Michael was supposed to be working on.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: No.

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.line: Okay, let me know if you find it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Okay, Okay, we don't have much time.  Just act normal.  Don't look at me people. Stop.  Don't look down. Don't look down. He's going to see me.  Don't look all the way up. Keep it at a normal height.  Okay. This is not Michael Scott talking right now, this is your future.  Hello, I am your future.  You're older, and you are very happy now.  Because you went with Michael Scott.  Right.  So everybody come on down.  Lets just crawl out of here together. Alright?  Come on!  Are you, are you doing your best here?  Are you being the best that you can be?  [Pam is thinking hard] Alright. Everybody who's going to go with me I want you to stomp your foot.  Okay, alright. Come on. You're coming with me.  Come on Phyllis.  Here we go, here we go!

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.line: Michael get up!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Oh God... okay alright. It's time to go it's time to go. Jim, let's go. Come on!

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.line: Michael, what are you doing?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I think maybe Hank should be here.

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.line: Hank?  No, I don't need Hank Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: You're going to mess with me, is that what you're going to do? I'll tell you something Charles, I don't even care. Cause I've got nothing got lose. [Charles steps towards Michael] Oh my God, OH GOD! No no, all right. Fine, it's not even worth it.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Oh no.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: What?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: I'm going with him.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: What? Pam!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: I'm going.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Pam! You can't be serious.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Michael, wait!  I'm coming with you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: You are?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Okay.  It's going to be great.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Great. Uh, except, I don't want to be a receptionist anymore.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Right... Executive assistant.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Salesman.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Alright, okay.  Deal! Okay, well... Jim?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Still no.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Well, okay, lets go.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Oh, all my stuff is still upstairs so...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Are people watching?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Probably.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Michael, its not how you leave in an office. It how you...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Jim Jim Jim... we're having a company meeting here.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: I'll bring your stuff home. Okay, bye.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Okay, see you later.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Bye.

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.line: So, we had a personnel change today.  Shouldn't effect our day to day.  But, until we get a new receptionist I want Kevin on the phones.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Phones?

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.line: Also, there has been too much wasted time.  So Stanley.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: [holding a crossword puzzle] Yes.

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.line: Yeah, I want you to be on top of that okay?  I want you to be my productivity czar. Okay, good.  Uh, okay that it on my list. So uh, you know, no excuses guys. Lets get going okay? [everyone leaves except Kevin and Stanley, who are sitting stunned in their chairs]
